intro: Karomia gigas, commonly known as the giant karomia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its large, glossy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role within its native habitat. Karomia gigas is also valued for its timber and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
